targets.expr:
1 - max without(prometheus_replica, organization) (
sum_over_time(slo:sli_error:ratio_rate5m{sloth_service=~"appcat-.+"}[$__range])
/ ignoring (sloth_window) count_over_time(slo:sli_error:ratio_rate5m{sloth_service=~"appcat-.+", service="VSHNPostgreSQL", name=~"$instance_name"}[$__range])
) >= 0

options.content: # IMPORTANT After each change please export this dashboard as JSON and update it in component-appcat repository

targets.expr: sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{job="kubelet", metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor", namespace="$namespace",container!="", image!="", pod=~"$instances"}) / sum(max by(pod) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{job="kube-state-metrics", namespace="$namespace", resource="memory", pod=~"$instances"}))

max(
    sum by (namespace,persistentvolumeclaim) (kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes{namespace="$namespace", persistentvolumeclaim=~"(${instances})-tbs.*"}) 
    /
    sum by (namespace,persistentvolumeclaim) (kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{namespace="$namespace", persistentvolumeclaim=~"(${instances})-tbs.*"}) 
    *
    on(namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) group_left(volume)
    kube_pod_spec_volumes_persistentvolumeclaims_info{pod=~"$instances"}
)

panels.description: High lag indicates issue with replication. Network or storage interfaces may not have enough bandwidth to handle incoming traffic and replication at the same time.
Low disk space or low inode count will result in data loss.

targets.expr: max((max(max by(persistentvolumeclaim) (1 - kubelet_volume_stats_available_bytes{namespace="$namespace", persistentvolumeclaim=~"$instances"} / kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{namespace="$namespace", persistentvolumeclaim=~"$instances"}))) OR (max by(persistentvolumeclaim) (kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_used{namespace="$namespace", persistentvolumeclaim=~"$instances"} / kubelet_volume_stats_inodes{namespace="$namespace", persistentvolumeclaim=~"$instances"})))

panels.description: Cluster Replication Health represents the availability of replica servers available to replace the primary in case of a failure.
Elapsed time since the last successful base backup.
panels.title: Last Base Backup

panels.description: High resource usage (CPU, Memory, DB Connections)

targets.expr: (sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{job="kubelet", metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor", namespace="$namespace",container!="", image!="", pod=~"$instances"}) / sum(max by(pod) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{job="kube-state-metrics", namespace="$namespace", resource="memory", pod=~"$instances"})))
(max(sum by (pod) (cnpg_backends_total{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$instances"}) / sum by (pod) (cnpg_pg_settings_setting{name="max_connections", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$instances"})))

panels.description:
Computes the time since the last known WAL archival in the primary.
We ensure to ignore the metric in the replicas by using (1 - cnpg_pg_replication_in_recovery ) as a multiplicative factor. It will be 0 for replicas, 1 for the primary.
panels.title: Last archived WAL

panels.description: Base Backups are considered healthy when there has been at least one base backup in the last 24 hours.
WAL is considered Healthy when the last WAL is 0min to 6min old, Delayed when it is less than 15min and Unsynced for >15min.

options.content: $instances

targets.expr: 100 * sum by (pod) (cnpg_backends_total{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$instances"}) / sum by (pod) (cnpg_pg_settings_setting{name="max_connections", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$instances"})

panels.title: Volume Space Usage: PGDATA and WAL
Volume Inode Usage: PGDATA and WAL

panels.description: Show the installed extensions and their versions
panels.title: Installed extensions
